messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] John Holt Books?
messages.msgSnippet: John Holt is timeless in all ways especially with very little changing in a culture that doesn t seem to be learning.  Lisa ... From:
messages.messageBody:
John Holt is timeless in all ways especially with very little changing
in a culture that doesn't seem to be learning. Lisa

-----Original Message-----
From: kevin.tucker@... [mailto:kevin.tucker@...]
Sent: Tuesday, October 15, 2002 8:50 AM
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] John Holt Books?

I like reading "How Children Fail". I had read it just after my wife
said, "what would you think.." about homeschooling, and reading that
book
helped me realize what a sham school is. It opened my eyes.

Kevin

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Shams
messages.msgSnippet: Also anything by John Taylor Gotto,  he is radical , for some
messages.messageBody:
Also anything by John Taylor Gotto, he is 'radical', for some< but he speaks so many truths for me. Dumbing Us Down is a nice little read.
Kelli
kevin.tucker@... wrote:I like reading "How Children Fail". I had read it just after my wife
said, "what would you think.." about homeschooling, and reading that book
helped me realize what a sham school is. It opened my eyes.

Kevin

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] John Holt Books?
messages.msgSnippet: I like reading How Children Fail .  I had read it just after my wife said, what would you think.. about homeschooling, and reading that book helped me
messages.messageBody:
I like reading "How Children Fail". I had read it just after my wife
said, "what would you think.." about homeschooling, and reading that book
helped me realize what a sham school is. It opened my eyes.

Kevin

messages.subject: Re: John Holt Books?
messages.msgSnippet: I really liked Growing Without Schooling: A Record of a Grassroots Movement.  It is the original text of the first 12 Growing Without Schooling magazines.
messages.messageBody:
I really liked Growing Without Schooling: A Record of a Grassroots
Movement. It is the original text of the first 12 Growing Without
Schooling magazines.
Sheila
